name: Use table-per-class-hierarchy when subclasses have few properties
description:
This rule reports all persistent entities (Hibernate, JPA or Jakarta Persistence) that do not use table-per-class-hierarchy for their subclasses when they have less than three attributes. This number is a threshold that can be changed if required.

This verification is limited to the first level of entities inheritance tree. For example, if the entity inheritance tree contains an entity C that inherits from entity B, that subsequently inherit from entity A, only the number of fields of entity B will be analyzed, not those from entity C.
output:
List all Hibernate, JPA or Jakarta Persistence Entities that do not use table-per-class-hierarchy strategy for its subclasses when they have fewer attributes than the threshold parameter.

It provides the following information:
 Hibernate, JPA or Jakarta Persistence Entity Full Name
rationale: If you require polymorphic associations (an association to a superclass, hence to all classes in the hierarchy with dynamic resolution of the concrete class at runtime) or queries, and sub-classes declare relatively few properties (particularly if the main difference between subclasses is in their behavior), lean toward the table-per-class-hierarchy model.
remediation: Use the table-per-class-hierarchy strategy to map the hierarchy.
remediationSample:
<class name="Animal" table="ANIMAL">
    <id name="id" type="long" column="ANIMAL_ID">
        <generator class="native"/>
    </id>
    <discriminator column="TYPE" type="string"/>
    <property name="amount" column="AMOUNT"/>

    // FIXED: table-per-class-hierarchy strategy is used
    <subclass name="Dog" discriminator-value="DOG">
        <property name="race" column="RACE"/>
    </subclass>

    <subclass name="Cat" discriminator-value="CAT">
        <property name="color" column="COLOR"/>
    </subclass>
</class>

----------------------------------------------------------
sample2:  Annotation Based

@Entity
@Inheritance(strategy = InheritanceType.SINGLE_TABLE) // Fixed
public class Transport {
    @Id
    @GeneratedValue(strategy = GenerationType.AUTO)
    @Column(name = "id")
    private int id;

    @Column(name = "name")
    private String name;
}

@Entity
public class Bus extends Transport {

    @Column(name = "capacity")
    private int capacity;
}
total: Number of Hibernate, JPA or Jakarta Persistence entities that are subclassed (subclass or joined-subclass) and that are not inheriting from another entity
alternativeName: Choose table-per-class-hierarchy when the maximum added attributes of subclasses does not exceed three

technicalCriteria.name: Efficiency - SQL and Data Handling Performance
